1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">-2H.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">-2H.7</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Media Arts</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-211-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Systems, Modeling and Creative Computation</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">John Connolly</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course provides students with a selection of methods and tools with which to better understand, explore, and integrate the multidisciplinary aspects of interactive media. Systems thinking, creative computation, and visual programming are emphasized, and students learn how these and other approaches can lead them to deeper levels of understanding of all forms of creative endeavour, not simply interactive media. No technical background is required, and students will use their newly gained skills to produce simple apps, simulations, games, and art works.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Adam Basanta</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">No description available at this time</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-413-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">The Art of Physical Computing</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">John Connolly</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to an active language of interactive, physical “making”. Using simple materials, and basic computational, electronic, and mechanical systems as a creative pallet, students create interactive objects, sculptures, toys, and wearable pieces. In doing so, they come to see these technologies as simply another set of tools with which to creatively self-express, experiment, or explore ideas and themes. The emphasis here is on providing students with an opportunity to explore the more tangible forms of interactive media art through the creation of novel physical artifacts.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, and Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-498-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Integrating Activity (IA)</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Bérengère Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is part of the Interactive Media Arts Profile Comprehensive Assessment that all students must pass in order to receive their DEC. In this course, under the guidance of a teacher, students will work on a major project related to their studies in the Profile. The project will consist primarily of the development, production, and evaluation of a creative or critical work. The project will provide them with opportunities to demonstrate their creativity, and their ability to integrate the knowledge, skills and attitudes (competencies) they have attained in their program of study. Research and interpretation skills, innovation and critical thinking skills, as well as English language skills will also be assessed in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-914-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">The Art of Game Design</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Shawn Bell</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Games have been an integral part of human culture for thousands of years. Currently games integrate all forms of media—including storytelling, architecture, cinema, voice, music, acting, animation, and artwork—into immersive, interactive experiences. This course provides an historical and cultural overview of play and gaming, including current issues and trends. It also explores the art of creating enriching experiences for audiences through game design, with particular emphasis on systems and the interplay of emergent levels and their aesthetic implications.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Shawn Bell</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Games have been an integral part of human culture for thousands of years. Students explore a variety of materials and techniques, including visual programming languages, to create interactive sound and music projects. Open to students with or without a musical background.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-917-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Interactive Arts: Local to Global</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Bérengère Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course examines a range of artistic and creative practices that fall under the umbrella of interactive arts. Students look at interactive art and artists from a variety of cultural backgrounds, and also at the interplay among art, artists, heritage and current cultural environments in local, regional, national and global contexts. The course touches on specific forms of interactive art such as responsive objects, web art, closed-circuit environments, and installations, as well as on broader issues such as control, embodiment and perception.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-923-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Tangible Media: Making Things Interactive</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Bérengère Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this playful and engaging course, students design simple interactive objects and explore their expressive potential. This is a hands-on, project-based workshop that sits at the intersection of art, crafts, design, and interactive technology. Students experiment with recyclable materials such as paper, wood, cardboard, or found objects like toys, and are introduced to some basic principles of mechanics, simple electronics, and ready-to-use interactive technologies like LittleBits. The course allows non-technical students to discover the creative potential of sculptural physical objects using various forms of interactivity. The functioning of some familiar objects (a child's mechanical toy, for example) is demystified and leveraged towards creative expression, prototyping and speculative design. No previous experience is required for this course; it is intended for a non-technical audience.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Medical Ultrasound Technology</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U21-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Ultrasound Instrumentation and Quality Control</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kieran David Bradshaw</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course further expands on the use of ultrasound instrumentation principles and various modes of acquisition. Applying knowledge developed in physics and instrumentation, students will learn to use advanced reconstruction software and tools to optimize ultrasound images. Students will further explore elements of a quality assurance program and will perform general quality control tests of devices and accessories. Students will document and analyze the results while referring to appropriate quality control documents. Also, they will explore documentation workflow in the ultrasound department, including the Radiology Information System (RIS) and Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS). This course will prime students for the application of these principles and procedures in the context of Clinical Education.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.34</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kieran David Bradshaw</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course further expands on the use of ultrasound instrumentation principles and various modes of acquisition. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U22-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Abdominal, Pelvic and Surface Ultrasound 1</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gaelle Bambi Mpiana</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on scanning course, students will learn how to plan for a general abdomen and pelvis examination. Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care, and instrumentation, students will learn to effectively acquire the proper diagnostic images and data while utilizing effective scanning techniques. They will incorporate their anatomy and physiology knowledge to analyze images and identify basic pathologies. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during a general abdomen and pelvis examination. This course will prime students for the further application of these principles and procedures in Abdominal, Pelvic and Surface Ultrasound 2.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gaelle Bambi Mpiana</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on scanning course, students will learn how to plan for a general abdomen and pelvis examination. Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care, and instrumentation, students will learn to effectively acquire the proper diagnostic images and data while utilizing effective scanning techniques. They will incorporate their anatomy and physiology knowledge to analyze images and identify basic pathologies. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during a general abdomen and pelvis examination. This course will prime students for the further application of these principles and procedures in Abdominal, Pelvic and Surface Ultrasound 2.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U23-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Medical Records of Ultrasound Patients</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford, Eleni Joannides</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to the basic principles and procedures of patient medical records. Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care, and fundamentals of the profession, students will learn to correlate relevant medical data to the examination to be performed. They will also learn to identify common pathologies seen in various imaging modalities. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during an ultrasound examination or procedure. This course will prime students for the application of these principles and procedures in the context of Clinical Education.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford, Eleni Joannides</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to the basic principles and procedures of patient medical records. Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care, and fundamentals of the profession, students will learn to correlate relevant medical data to the examination to be performed. They will also learn to identify common pathologies seen in various imaging modalities. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during an ultrasound examination or procedure. This course will prime students for the application of these principles and procedures in the context of Clinical Education.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford, Eleni Joannides</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to the basic principles and procedures of patient medical records. <p>Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</p></div></div><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-901-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Appreciating Music</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will help students to develop their aesthetic creative & critical listening skills. It will introduce students to the concepts and terminology required to understand and appreciate music. Through the works of outstanding artists, students will be exposed to a diversity of musical styles and genres. Students will also learn how to listen perceptively to the techniques composers use to achieve their artistic goals.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will help students to develop their aesthetic creative & critical listening skills. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-924-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Vocal Performance</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will provide students with musical and vocal techniques required to create and produce performance projects; students will gain an understanding of the vocal mechanism and sound production, as well as the musical expressive elements that are required for song performances. Students will be introduced to vocal and musical terminology as well as critical feedback tools in order to critique their solo, duo and group performances.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-931-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Guitar 1</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This beginner's class will help students to explore and experiment with different basic techniques (mostly finger style) in simple classical and popular guitar repertoire. The students will apply these different technical difficulties to reflect specific main cultural visions. For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings). Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-932-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Guitar 2</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course does not have any pre-requisites. It is an introduction to pickstyle guitar. Students will explore a variety of musical styles and will learn to play song accompaniments as well as compositions specially arranged for ensemble performance. For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings). Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-933-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Comprehensive Guitar Techniques</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This introductory course is a comprehensive approach to right hand guitar techniques. Students will acquire both pickstyle and fingerstyle techniques, and will understand the relative advantages and disadvantages of each of these methods, enabling them to make effective choices in their creative projects. With these techniques students will explore a variety of musical styles and will learn to use the guitar for song accompaniment as well as ensemble performance. For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings).    Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; The course will focus on Classical music, jazz, rock & contemporary styles.  Principal styles will be considered along with major composers, performers, and types of compositions.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Appreciating Music</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The aim of this course is to develop the skill of perceptive listening and to increase the students’ understanding and enjoyment of music. Students will be taught the fundamentals of music theory and how to create and perform vocal harmonies in contemporary songs.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Vocal Expression</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to the principles of the vocal mechanism, sound production, pitch control, rhythmic accuracy, and musical expression. Students will gain an understanding of basic ear training, musical vocabulary and theory; they will learn how to apply these concepts to singing.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Vocal Performance</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will provide students with musical and vocal techniques required to create and produce performance projects; students will gain an understanding of the vocal mechanism and sound production, as well as the musical expressive elements that are required for song performances. Students will be introduced to vocal and musical terminology as well as critical feedback tools in order to critique their solo, duo and group performances.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Guitar 1</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00004</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This beginner's class will help students to explore and experiment with different basic techniques (mostly finger style) in simple classical and popular guitar repertoire. The students will apply these different technical difficulties to reflect specific main cultural visions. For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings). Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Guitar 2</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00005</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course does not have any pre-requisites. It is an introduction to pickstyle guitar. Students will explore a variety of musical styles and will learn to play song accompaniments as well as compositions specially arranged for ensemble performance.  For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings). Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Comprehensive Guitar Techniques</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00006</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course does not have any pre-requisites. It is a comprehensive introduction to right hand guitar techniques. Students will acquire both pickstyle and fingerstyle techniques, and will understand the relative advantages and disadvantages of each of these methods, enabling them to make effective choices in their creative projects. With these techniques students will explore a variety of musical styles and will learn to use the guitar for song accompaniment as well as ensemble performance. For all guitar classes: Students must provide their own guitar (acoustic with metal strings or classical with nylon strings). Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Nursing</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-212-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Nursing the Hospitalized Adult</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-180-D, TBA-180-E, Jian Ning Li, Lucien Chiasson, Magdalena Mlek, Rhizlane Bougrine</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This Nursing course introduces students to the acutely ill medical/surgical adult patients who are receiving diagnostic and therapeutic measures. Previous knowledge obtained will be used as a foundation to develop the ability to identify Nursing-related issues connected to health problems and outline appropriate Nursing interventions. In the theoretical and practical part of the course a strong emphasis will be placed on the connections between the ability to access a patient and the development of effective Nursing interventions. Key concepts such as the complications of immobility, care of the surgical patient, intervening with patients in acute or short term care situations with pain, musculoskeletal and cardiovascular conditions will be discussed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Stage may include days, evenings, and weekends.<br>PLUS INTENSIVE</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Jan 17, 2023</td><td data-label="End Date">May 11, 2023</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-214-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Basic Health Assessment</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Charlie Myriam Julien, Jian Ning Li</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course builds on the nursing theoretical and practical knowledge and skills developed in the first semester of the Nursing program. It is designed to further develop the nursing student’s understanding of the experience of health and illness of the adult patient/client through the classroom, laboratory and clinical experiences. Students will develop knowledge about common diseases and health conditions, with a focus on documentation of assessment findings, and care provided, as well as in the creating of a nursing plan of care. Students will also have the opportunity to consolidate their learning of basic health assessment skills in the clinical setting, including physical, psychosocial, cultural and spiritual health of their patients.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Charlie Myriam Julien, Jian Ning Li</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course builds on the nursing theoretical and practical knowledge and skills developed in the first semester of the Nursing program. Students will develop knowledge about common diseases and health conditions, with a focus on documentation of assessment findings, and care provided, as well as in the creating of a nursing plan of care. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-424-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Medical/Surgical Nursing Winter</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-180-A, Geneviève McCaughey, Natalie Turner, Patricia Bondu, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Prerequisites: 101-987–DW Human Body for Nurses III, 180-313-DW Nutrition; 180-333-DW Maternal/Child Nursing. Corequisites: 101-988-DW Human Body for Nurses IV, 180-414-DW Pharmacology. In this Nursing course, students will integrate the knowledge and abilities learned in previous program-specific courses to care for adult medical/surgical patients with complex health problems. The Dawson College Nursing Model discussed in previous nursing courses will now be used in the planning and implementation of nursing care. Complex disease processes that affect multiple body systems (e.g. Diabetes Mellitus), chronic illness (e.g. Cirrhosis, Crohn’s Disease and Neoplasms) and concepts of Loss and Grief as it relates to chronicity will be explored. In the clinical area the student will have ample opportunity to elaborate on and apply the principles of surgical asepsis such as urinary catheterizations, tracheostomy and ostomy care and care of complex wounds and dressings.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Stage may include days, evenings, and weekends.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-434-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Maternal/Child Health Nursing Winter</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Marie-Christine Borruel, Meggie Carpel, Natalie Morin, Shafiqa Awj Allahyar, Sherry McMillan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will provide the student with an understanding of Nursing concepts related to birth, first year of life, early childhood, adolescence, parental relationship (pregnancy, labor, childbirth nursing, post-natal follow-up, the family’s needs and care, child/parents interactions). With the help of the Dawson College Nursing Model a strong emphasis will be placed on understanding the needs of caregivers and patients alike. Promotion and maintenance of optimal health is one of the highlights of this course.    ?</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Stage may include days, evenings, and weekends.<br>PLUS INTENSIVE</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="End Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="End Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-441-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness II</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-180-D, Geneviève McCaughey, Marie-Christine Borruel, Meggie Carpel, Natalie Morin, Patricia Bondu, Sherry McMillan, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In the course Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness II, students will continue to explore nutritional and pharmacological management for diseases that affect the gastrointestinal, immune and central nervous system (CNS). Using the major body systems, chronic illnesses that are prevalent in today’s society and prototype medications as the organizing frameworks, students will develop a deeper understanding of the non-pharmacological (nutrition) and pharmacological treatment available to manage these illnesses. Case studies will be used to describe the pharmacological and nutritional aspects of nursing care. The nurses’ role regarding patients’ adherence to prescribed therapies (pharmacological and nutritional guidelines) will also be examined. At the completion of the two courses, students will have a comprehensive perspective of how nutritional and pharmacological management are intrinsically linked to optimize patient outcome.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.2</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-180-D, Geneviève McCaughey, Marie-Christine Borruel, Meggie Carpel, Natalie Morin, Patricia Bondu, Sherry McMillan, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In the course Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness II, students will continue to explore nutritional and pharmacological management for diseases that affect the gastrointestinal, immune and central nervous system (CNS). In compliance with the Nursing program exit profile, the student will demonstrate effective English and basic French communication skills, using the Dawson College Nursing Model to make judgments and intervene based on a body of knowledge from Nursing and act towards achieving personal, professional growth and a commitment to lifelong learning.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Stage may include days, evenings, weekends, and all 3 shifts.<br>PLUS INTENSIVE</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="End Date">Jan 16, 2023</td><td data-label="Time">7:00 AM - 8:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Stage</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Philosophy</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-101-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Philosophy</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">7 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. In a broad sense, this course explores the human condition, and the ways we humans have tried to understand and define ourselves, our world and our possibilities. As this is an introductory course, students will also learn and practice the philosophical fundamentals of sound argumentation. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophy’s relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4F.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4F.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brian Redekopp</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them.
