This course is an opportunity for students to reflect on the knowledge gained in all of their courses. Class activities and projects will initiate and integrate this process of reflection. These activities will include preparing a digital portfolio, writing an artist statement, producing an exhibition catalogue, producing an exhibition, and a studio based self-directed project. In the context of a self-directed project students will select subject matter, do research, use techniques and processes appropriate to produce an artwork of exhibition quality.  The annual Visual Arts Graduating Exhibition is produced collectively by the students, and provides an opportunity to publicly show some of the best art works produced in this course and concurrent Term 4 studio courses.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Visual Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.8</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joe Becker</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This Term 4 course focuses on the Comprehensive Examination and integrates knowledge from all Visual Arts studio, art history, and core courses.  This course is an opportunity for students to reflect on the knowledge gained in all of their courses. Class activities and projects will initiate and integrate this process of reflection. These activities will include preparing a digital portfolio, writing an artist statement, producing an exhibition catalogue, producing an exhibition, and a studio based self-directed project. In the context of a self-directed project students will select subject matter, do research, use techniques and processes appropriate to produce an artwork of exhibition quality.  The annual Visual Arts Graduating Exhibition is produced collectively by the students, and provides an opportunity to publicly show some of the best art works produced in this course and concurrent Term 4 studio courses.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Visual Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.15</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4G.15</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">510-921-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Life and Still Life Drawing</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Natalie Olanick</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Life and Still Life Drawing enhances and refines drawing from observation skills through life and still-life studies. Elements of composition and their effects in the representation of reality are explored in depth. Notions of time, movement, metamorphosis and serial drawings are introduced as exercises linking the students’ imagination to observation-based drawing.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Graphic Design</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Antoinetta Grassi</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Life and Still Life Drawing enhances and refines drawing from observation skills through life and still-life studies. Elements of composition and their effects in the representation of reality are explored in depth. Notions of time, movement, metamorphosis and serial drawings are introduced as exercises linking the students’ imagination to observation-based drawing.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Graphic Design</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">510-922-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">3D Foundations</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Nina Dubois</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">3D Foundations deals with creative methods for the transformation and abstraction of visual elements in an exploration of the three-dimensional graphic object. Natural and synthetic materials are to create three-dimensional form with both manual and machine-assisted skills. Visual, tactile, and spatial organization, as well as symbolic and metaphoric awareness are stressed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Graphic Design</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Nina Dubois</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">3D Foundations deals with creative methods for the transformation and abstraction of visual elements in an exploration of the three-dimensional graphic object. Natural and synthetic materials are to create three-dimensional form with both manual and machine-assisted skills. Visual, tactile, and spatial organization, as well as symbolic and metaphoric awareness are stressed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Graphic Design</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 3:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 3:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-113-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Studio Art</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joe Becker</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to contemporary visual culture through guided research and studio projects involving drawing, acrylic painting, collage, photomontage (including digital platforms).  Students will become fluent in the application of visual language through exploration of two-dimensional compositional strategies.  They will broaden their research skills while becoming familiar with major art trends, artists, current visual practices but also making connections with other fields of study through numerous trips to contemporary galleries and museums.  Project research will be conducted through use of the web, the library and critical readings.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 12:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-313-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Sculpture and Ideas</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">David Baumflek</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students will explore the sculptural relationship between form and meaning.  Topical written and visual research will set the path for exercises and projects.  Traditional and contemporary sculptural processes such as clay modelling, casting, assemblage and construction will be taught in fully equipped studios including the wood shop.  The projects will help develop analytical and critical skills within the creation of three-dimensional form.  A gallery or museum visit will allow students to be confronted with artwork by professional artists which will enrich their visual vocabulary.  Students will learn to critique works and sharpen their point of view through the application of concepts, compositional principles and vocabulary taught in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.8</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-314-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Printmaking</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Julianna Joos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The foundations of the print were laid with the first incised line on a rock wall, in stone, bone, horn or metal. The course will trace printmaking’s evolution from a reproduction technique to its role as an original medium of contemporary expression.  Students will learn the vocabulary specific to printmaking allowing them to appreciate the qualities of an original print.  Students will explore the intaglio, relief and/or stencil processes through the creation of original prints.  Technical exploration will include the use of carving tools for incising plates, the use of rollers and squeegees for inking, paper preparation, and the setting of presses.  A small edition of original prints will be produced in each technique explored.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 12:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-414-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Drawing/Painting Studio Projects</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Antoinetta Grassi</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to various techniques in painting and drawing.  Students will develop an awareness of the physical properties of painting mediums through a number of exercises exploring the dynamic use of acrylic colours.  Use of painting and drawing materials will be developed through both non-representational and figurative exercises.  Compositions of colour, line and shape will be explored offering students fundamental expressive structures for working.  Students will be encouraged to collect visual source material from sketches and collages to help assemble a bank of images.  This studio environment will foster an open yet critical dialogue and response to art-making allowing for greater exploration in future courses. Students will be shown works by known artists from the past and present to help locate and enrich their studio endeavours.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-498-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Integrating Activity (IA)</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Natalie Olanick</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Under the guidance of a teacher, the students will work on a self-directed major project that will consist primarily of the development, production and evaluation of a creative work.  The project will provide them with opportunities to demonstrate their creativity, and their ability to integrate the knowledge, skills and attitudes they have attained in both specific education and general education courses.  Research, interpretation, innovation and critical thinking skills will also be assessed in this course.  Students will present their works in a group exhibition and produce a catalogue.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Lise-Hélène Larin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Under the guidance of a teacher, the students will work on a self-directed major project that will consist primarily of the development, production and evaluation of a creative work.  The project will provide them with opportunities to demonstrate their creativity, and their ability to integrate the knowledge, skills and attitudes they have attained in both specific education and general education courses.  Research, interpretation, innovation and critical thinking skills will also be assessed in this course.  Students will present their works in a group exhibition and produce a catalogue.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-912-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Drawing Techniques</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Julianna Joos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The expressive power of drawing as a visual language is introduced and investigated through the exploitation of various drawing techniques.  Working from observation of live models, objects, the environment, and from imagined forms, the students will acquire skills while sketching and rendering with a number of basic drawing materials.  Through representation and abstraction, they will apply their research and learn compositional strategies to express their ideas visually.  Historical and contemporary trends in drawing approaches will be examined through presentations, and students will have an opportunity to discuss and critique their drawings as explored in studio or independently.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Julianna Joos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The expressive power of drawing as a visual language is introduced and investigated through the exploitation of various drawing techniques.  Working from observation of live models, objects, the environment, and from imagined forms, the students will acquire skills while sketching and rendering with a number of basic drawing materials.  Through representation and abstraction, they will apply their research and learn compositional strategies to express their ideas visually.  Historical and contemporary trends in drawing approaches will be examined through presentations, and students will have an opportunity to discuss and critique their drawings as explored in studio or independently.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-914-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Painting</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Natalie Olanick</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This introductory studio course in painting will establish a working knowledge of paint mixing and application, painting supports, colour theory and composition.  Painting projects will explore modes of representation and abstraction.  Students will work with acrylic colours to discover the many ways paint can be handled.  Students will learn subtractive colour mixing while investigating genres such as still life, figure, portrait and landscape.  Scale will be considered in paintings of various sizes on different supports.  Students will become aware of different periods and approaches to painting to help focus their own preferences.  In-class critiques will incorporate an understanding of relevant terminology.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Natalie Olanick</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This introductory studio course in painting will establish a working knowledge of paint mixing and application, painting supports, colour theory and composition.  Painting projects will explore modes of representation and abstraction.  Students will work with acrylic colours to discover the many ways paint can be handled.  Students will learn subtractive colour mixing while investigating genres such as still life, figure, portrait and landscape.  Scale will be considered in paintings of various sizes on different supports.  Students will become aware of different periods and approaches to painting to help focus their own preferences.  In-class critiques will incorporate an understanding of relevant terminology.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-915-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Sculpture: Creativity and Processes</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Lise-Hélène Larin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Using topical research as a starting point to incite their creativity, students will produce sculptural works using both traditional and contemporary approaches.  Students will learn to differentiate the characteristics of various techniques as they apply them to their creative process such as modeling, direct casting in clay, carving in plaster, and assembling with wood and found objects.  Students will visit one exhibition to explore the creative potential of sculptural techniques and processes.  Students will learn to comment and evaluate their creative projects, applying the compositional principles, concepts and vocabulary taught in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.8</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Nina Dubois</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Using topical research as a starting point to incite their creativity, students will produce sculptural works using both traditional and contemporary approaches.  Students will learn to differentiate the characteristics of various techniques as they apply them to their creative process such as modeling, direct casting in clay, carving in plaster, and assembling with wood and found objects.  Students will visit one exhibition to explore the creative potential of sculptural techniques and processes.  Students will learn to comment and evaluate their creative projects, applying the compositional principles, concepts and vocabulary taught in the course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.8</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-916-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Drawing and Ideas</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Antoinetta Grassi</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students will explore the medium of drawing in two related ways: ongoing exposure to historical and contemporary forms of drawing through planned fieldtrips to museums and galleries, and by developing a personal approach to drawing related to ideas addressed during the fieldtrips as well as to contemporary culture at large.  These may include identity, gender, and politics to name a few.  Through a series of in-class projects and assignments, students will learn introductory forms of composition through the exploration of material, methods and techniques; for example, line quality, shading and hatching as well as the exploration of dry and wet media such as ink, charcoal, and graphite.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 12:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.25</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-922-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Graphic Novels and Artists' Books</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Julianna Joos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed to familiarize students with the relationships between visual images and text by examining representative collected works of both genres.  The course will explore two related types of text and image art – the artist's book and the graphic novel.  These art forms will be investigated in relationship to their contexts in fine arts and popular culture forms of creative graphic production.  Students will produce several artist's books and graphic novels applying both two- and three-dimensional aspects of the art form. This course will identify and investigate the main characteristics of both genres and allow students to develop their skills in representational and abstract image making, while helping further explore the potential for visual communicative through an on-going exposure to historical and contemporary precedents.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-923-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Collage and Mixed Media</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Naomi London</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Collage derives from the French “coller”; a technique coined by the early 20th century cubist painters Picasso and Braque.  Students will discover different collage techniques in 2D and/or 3D assemblage, through which they will explore strategies for choosing and combining suggestive images and/or objects, and finding ways of composing a collage and/or an assemblage.  Strategies will be developed for visual research and idea development, and for choosing and incorporating thematic elements.  The acquisition of technical skills will enable the production of art projects in 2D and/or 3D assemblage.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, and Literature</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.23</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">511-BXA-03</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Applications in Fine Arts</div> <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">4 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Painting and Creative Expression</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">David Philip Hall</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course focuses on contemporary and historical modes of artistic production. In particular, students learn colour mixing and the use of grounds, glazes, stains, washes and impasto techniques; colour harmonies and relationships; and how to critique a work of art. Students also learn to relate to works of contemporary artists and paintings of various periods.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Collage</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Maria Chronopoulos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course encourages students to explore the elements of texture and surface in a tactile and expressive manner. Particular attention is devoted to basic principles of composition; mark-making with a variety of instruments; the juxtaposition of various shapes and materials; the exploration of harmony, discord, value, and colour relationships; to both the creation of representational and non-representational artwork.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Drawing and Creative Expression</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Naomi London</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course encourages creative and expressive use of different drawing materials and drawing surfaces. Conte, charcoal, chalks and graphite will be used in both representational and nonrepresentational compositions. Drawing from  memory and the imagination will be included in a number of exercises. Students will also draw from still-life, nature and the model. Traditional and contemporary trends in drawing will be examined. Students also learn how to critique a work of art using appropriate terminology.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Tuesday, February 14, 2023</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2G.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Graphic Novels and Artists' Books</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00004</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Julianna Joos</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed to familiarize students with the relationships between visual images and text by examining representative collected works of both genres.
